Detailed Description

Flow of control with data flow graph representation

The RFO::Thread represents computation (work) as a list of Task managed by the Reference Order for Athapascan1. Tasks are assumed to be independent: stealing a RFO::Thread will returned, if exists, the last recent task of the stack following the reference order of execution.

RFO::Thread allows to be aborted using the E_ABRT event with the inherited kill method.

virtual void RFO::Thread::sync (  )  [virtual]

Sync On return to this method, all closures of the top frame have been executed This method is equivalent to execute( top() ), but it is virtual in order to be overloaded by derived class.
